intro: Hibbertia ancistrophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Its leaves are narrow and often have a zigzag or wavy margin, which is a distinctive botanical feature. Hibbertia ancistrophylla is a perennial shrub that produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
